Tuva Sundbom

Music and creativity have been a common thread throughout 20-year-old Tuva Sundbomâ€™s life. Under the alias TUVA, she creates modern and unpolished alternative pop in Swedish. At the center are playfully packaged anecdotes with an ever-present undertone of youthful melancholy. With a charmingly unique and contrastingly energetic sound, it often nods to the unruly indie rock of the 2000s. In its ambiguity, TUVA's music embodies a young person with their whole life ahead of them. The creative process almost always starts in the black sketchbook that TUVA always carries in her bag. Filled with handwritten quotes, ink scribbles, and abstract splashes of color, the pages appear almost chaotic to an outsider. She uses the book to jot down and reflect on thoughts, feelings, and everyday observations. From there, she picks pieces that are pieced together into songs. Her lyrics cover social issues, relationships, musings, as well as fantasy scenarios, dark humor, and self-reflection. In TUVA's songs, contrasts and emotions take center stage. When it's at its softest and most fragile, the listener is suddenly surprised by a messy guitar or an unexpected twist in the narrative.
